intro: Maba nandarivatensis, commonly known as the golden maba tree, is a tropical plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Sapotaceae and is characterized by its smooth, light green bark and large, palmate leaves. The tree produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in panicles, followed by edible, orange-colored fruits. Its botanical features make it an important species in both ecological and economic contexts within its native habitat.
